glosses: to burn, be on fire; to burn up, burn down
to be burned, scorched, or singed; to get a burn or scald; to get sunburned
to be blazing hot, be hot as blazes
to be in a bad predicament, be sunk, be done for, have had it; to get it in the neck; to be in the soup

examples.translation: Your little brother will start playing when you lose.

glosses: to feel great sadness (at); to feel bitter regret (for)
to be burning (with an emotion, a feeling), to have a burning desire (for).

etymology:
From Ottoman Turkish یانمق (yanmak, “to be burnt, suffer”), from Proto-Turkic *yan- (“to burn (intr.), blaze up”).
Cognate with Karakhanid [script needed] (yan-, “to burn”), Azerbaijani yanmaq, Crimean Tatar yanmaq (“to burn”), Bashkir яныу (yanıw, “to burn”), Chuvash ҫун (śun, “to burn, shine, worry, suffer”), Kazakh жану (janu, “to burn”), Kyrgyz жануу (januu, “to burn”), Turkmen ýanmak (“to be burnt”), Uzbek yonmoq (“to ignite, glow”), Yakut сандаар (sandaar, “to shine”) (< caus. *jan-tɨr-).
